DataElement.preferredName: Medical Condition Performed Observation Outcome Occurrence Date and Time Range Validation Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded value specifying the degree of authoritativeness or certitude of the occurrence date. EXAMPLE(S): "date estimated", "date greater than 100 days, date is correct", "date less than 100 days, date is correct" NOTE(S): (1) The concept of "date unknown" is captured by a null flavor of "UNK" on the date range attribute, rather than a code in this attribute. (2) A patient might have recovered from neutrophil in the past, but isn't sure of the exact date and state "I think it was in January of 2005". This would be recorded with an occurrence date range of "January 2005" and an uncertain occurrence date code of "estimated".

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Medical Condition Performed Observation Outcome Occurrence Date and Time Range Validation Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the study or practice of medicine.:A state of being, such as a state of health.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.:The act of validating; finding or testing the truth of something.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.
